summary:
I am Emeritus Professor of Functional Linguistics at VU University Amsterdam, now mainly working as a Consultant in Languages and Linguistics, with over 40 years of experience behind me. My skills and expertise are primarily in European languages, with a specialization in English linguistics; I am fluent in several European languages. I take a functionalist approach to language analysis; that is, I am convinced that the structure of languages is adapted to their primary purpose, communication between human beings. I am editor of the world's major journal in functional linguistics, Functions of Language.

I have been associated with three research groups: SCIMITAR, at Santiago de Compostela, Spain; EMO-FUNDETT, at UNED, Spain; and CELGA-ILTEC, at Coimbra, Portugal. I am experienced in research assessment and have worked for several years as an expert -- and in 2012 as lead expert -- for EACEA, an agency of the European Commission.

Specialties: Functional linguistics
Postgraduate training and supervision
Curriculum development
Assessment of grant applications

It is one of the major products of the EMO-FUNDETT research group. See also our MOOC at https://canal.uned.es/video/5a6f39f6b1111f39448b456a', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Laura', 'last_name': 'Alba-Juez', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Catedrática de Lingüística Inglesa/ Full Professor.                         Vicerrectora de Internacionalización y Multilingüismo (UNED)'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lachlan', 'last_name': 'Mackenzie', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent Research Professional'}]}, {'title': 'Book on Discourse Analysis', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': '"The Construction of Discourse as Verbal Interaction" showcases new work on discourse analysis by big names in the field and promising early-career researchers. Arising from the latest in the series of IWoDA workshops in Santiago de Compostela, it provides novel insights into both the explicit and the implicit characteristics of discourse as used in verbal interaction. This, in general terms, is the challenging terrain into which the contributors to this volume have ventured. The book combines theoretical issues with a practical orientation, comparing languages, analysing different registers, studying the openings of Skype conversations, and much more besides; it will prove highly relevant for postgraduate and advanced practitioners of discourse analysis, interaction studies, semantics and pragmatics. It was edited together with María de los Ángeles Gómez González and appeared in September 2018 with John Benjamins Publishing Company. The book is a major product of the project \'The construction of discourse as social interaction: Contrastive implications and applications\'.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'MARÍA DE LOS ÁNGELES', 'last_name': 'GÓMEZ GONZÁLEZ', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CATEDRÁTICA DE UNIVERSIDAD en Universidad de Santiago de Compostela'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lachlan', 'last_name': 'Mackenzie', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent Research Professional'}]}, {'title': 'Language Rich Europe', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Language Rich Europe created an informed dialogue with leaders in government, educational institutions, public services, business and the media across Europe, highlighting the importance of multilingualism in achieving more prosperous and stable societies.
